title: Does Eddie Van Halen have the fastest fingers ever on guitar? - Quora

response.answer_text: We could build a machine to play guitar faster than any human who ever lived, but so what? Speed does not magically translate into artistic quality. Why does anyone even care which guitarist has the fastest fingers ever? Not to knock Eddie Van Halen, but there have been many other guitarists who, like him, combine speed with musical genius. Check out John McLaughlin and the late Allan Holdsworth, for example, and Django Reinhardt and the Gypsy guitarists who followed him. You want speed? I’ll leave you with this clip from the amazing Danny Gatton:  All these players were about lots more than just speed.

No; EVH isn’t the fastest. There are a number of guitarists than can not only play faster than Van Halen, but can play more technically demanding material. Identifying “the” fastest is impossible (plus pointless; there is such a thing as “too fast”), but just to name two great fast players, I’d like to shout out Michael Angelo Batio (author of “Speed Kills”), and the late Shawn Lane.

To be honest, I really don’t pay attention to that stuff and would have to google it. I believe the title used to belong to Steve Vai, but most pros don’t really pay attention to who's the fastest as the goal is to make beautiful music and get out what's in your head. Melody is always paramount, and speed is very low on the list of priorities.

In the 500+ year history of guitar, at least another person probably tied or surpassed him for speed, but so what???. Isn’t it good enough that he is very fast and an excellent musician? Thank heavens that music is not included in the Olympics - - not everything should be a competition.

No. That is your answer. Check out Paul Gilbert for one example. Eddie is very good. I for one believe he is the guy who forever changed the way guitar was played. Sure you had Hendrix, but Eddie re wrote the script.
No, I’m fact he’s not up there at all in terms of speed. Google “fastest guitar players” and take a look at his guy doing flight of the bumblebee at 600bpm
